title: Act 2020 (No. 28 of 2020) and having consulted with the Minister for Justice,
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Central Mental Hospital (Relocation)
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Central Mental Hospital (Relocation) 

Act 2020 (Commencement) Order 2022.

title: Act 2020 (No. 28 of 2020) and having consulted with the Minister for Justice,
heading: In this Order, “Act of 2020” means the Central Mental Hospital
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order, “Act of 2020” means the Central Mental Hospital 

(Relocation) Act 2020 (No. 28 of 2020).
text_norm: 2 order act 2020 mean central mental hospital (relocation) act 2020 (no 28 2020)

title: Act 2020 (No. 28 of 2020) and having consulted with the Minister for Justice,

text_raw:
3. The 24th day of October 2022 is appointed as the day on which the Act 

of 2020, other than section 7, shall come into operation.

title: Act 2020 (No. 28 of 2020) and having consulted with the Minister for Justice,
heading: 4. The 13th day of November 2022 is appointed as the day on which
text_raw:
4. The 13th day of November 2022 is appointed as the day on which 

section 7 of the Act of 2020 shall come into operation. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 October, 2022. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 25th October, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [531] 3
text_norm: 4 13th day november 2022 appointed day section 7 act 2020 shall come operation given official seal 20 october 2022 stephen donnelly minister health notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 25th october 2022 531 3

title: Act 2020 (No. 28 of 2020) and having consulted with the Minister for Justice,
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order appoints the 24th October 2022 as the day on which all sections of 
the Central Mental Hospital (Relocation) Act 2020, except section 7, come into 
operation. This Order further appoints 13th November 2022 as the day on 
which section 7 of the Central Mental Hospital (Relocation) Act 2020 comes 
into operation. This Act provides for the relocation of the Central Mental 
Hospital from its current location in Dundrum to Portrane, for the transfer of 
persons lawfully detained in Dundrum to Portrane, and to provide for 
transitional arrangements during that transfer, for the closure of the Dundrum 
facility, and for the repeal of section 39 of the Mental Treatment Act 1961. The 
repeal of section 39 of the Mental Treatment Act 1961 is contained in section 7 
of the Central Mental Hospital (Relocation) Act 2020, which can only be 
commenced upon the opening of the new facility in Portrane. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [531]
